snippet: The trust level was not high in court and at the police clerk’s window in Ferguson, Mo., this week as municipal penalties were scaled back in an effort to repair the city’s frayed relationship with the black community.
abstract: Unrelenting anger of residents of Ferguson, Mo, toward police and local courts has pushed elected city officials to scale back municipal penalties that had helped fill the city’s coffers even as they had lightened the wallets of the poor; effort is part of city initiative to repair its frayed relationship with black residents in wake of killing of an unarmed black teenager by a white police officer.
lead_paragraph: The trust level was not high in court and at the police clerk’s window in Ferguson, Mo., this week as municipal penalties were scaled back in an effort to repair the city’s frayed relationship with the black community.

headline.main: Mistrust Lingers as Ferguson Takes New Tack on Fines
headline.print_headline: Mistrust Lingers as Ferguson Takes New Tack on Fines
